lan.eli5: LAN is like all your home gadgets talking to each other in the same room.
lan.boss: A LAN (Local Area Network) connects devices within a limited area like a home or office for fast communication.
lan.sysadmin: LANs use Ethernet or Wi-Fi to connect endpoints within a small geographic area, typically relying on switches, routers, and private IPs.
lan.use_case: Used to connect your computer, printer, and smart devices to your home router.

wan.eli5: A WAN is like a bunch of homes or cities all connected together.
wan.boss: A WAN (Wide Area Network) connects networks over large distances, like the internet or company branches.
wan.sysadmin: WANs link LANs across locations using leased lines, MPLS, VPNs, or the internet, and often require routing protocols and NAT.
wan.use_case: Used by companies to connect branch offices across cities.

wlan.eli5: WLAN is your Wi-Fi—it’s how you get the internet without wires.
wlan.boss: A WLAN (Wireless LAN) connects devices wirelessly within a local area, typically using Wi-Fi standards.
wlan.sysadmin: WLANs follow IEEE 802.11 standards and provide network access over 2.4GHz/5GHz/6GHz bands using SSIDs, APs, and security protocols like WPA3.
wlan.use_case: Used to allow phones, laptops, and smart devices to connect without Ethernet cables.
